channel.title: Fill me in
channel.description:
Well not sure if I should post this here or what, but since the server help section is full of questions a monkey could answer I think this may be your best help question yet.
Anyways, Im from classic section and going to be messing around with rs2 for a bit. So I got some questions.
1)There any servers with mysql? If so are they released or private. If you know of a released one give me a link.
2)Where exactly is rs2 development currently at? (I mean like, before when this all started the main thing was to get your client to "login". So where are you at now? Trying to get your source more stability or what?)
3)What tools are publicly available? Example: Interface maker. Is there a map editor or anything?
4)Why are objects/npcs/items in text files?

item.title: Fill me in
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

It would not be hard to make one with SQL, as you would only have to replace the save character and load character methods. Even though it’s easy, it would be hard for you to find one.

EDIT: Si Force beat me to it…

Read full topic

item.title: Fill me in
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

There are actually one or two servers with MySQL implemented that were released ages back, although you’ll have to go through a lot of digging to find them.

Read full topic

item.title: Fill me in
item.dc:creator: @Old_Rsc_Player Old Rsc Player
item.description:
@Old_Rsc_Player wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:4, topic:330817”][quote author=Old Rsc Player link=topic=427191.msg3137284#msg3137284 date=1267137198]
Thanks.
[/quote]
Don’t trust his answers.

1 ) No
2 ) We are much further now. Look back into the development section to see some.
3 ) There are 317 map editors, Tom’s cache editor, and many tools for creating commands etc
4 ) Those are just lists[/quote]

Im personally waiting for like 4 people to answer

You sure there are no servers with mysql? I remember seeing people try or talk about it.

thanks for answers

Read full topic

item.title: Fill me in
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Old Rsc Player:

Thanks.

Don’t trust his answers.

1 ) No
2 ) We are much further now. Look back into the development section to see some.
3 ) There are 317 map editors, Tom’s cache editor, and many tools for creating commands etc
4 ) Those are just lists

Read full topic

item.title: Fill me in
item.dc:creator: @iKilem iKilem
item.description:
@iKilem wrote:

  1. Yes. I personally can’t give you specific link however.

  2. The only thing left is bug fixes. A stable and scalable source would be hyperion.

  3. None that I’m aware of.

  4. I’m sure there are some servers that use xml (which is what should be used for configurations).

Read full topic
